Package org.kiji.schema.layout

Kiji table layouts.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
AvroSchemaResolver Interface for functions that resolve AvroSchema descriptors into Schema objects.
KijiTableLayoutDatabase A database of Kiji table layouts.
 

Class Summary
AvroSchemaIdResolver Resolves AvroSchema descriptors into Schema IDs.
CellSpec Specification of a column in a Kiji table.
ColumnReaderSpec Specification of read properties applied when decoding cells from a column in a Kiji table.
KijiColumnNameTranslator Translates between HTable and Kiji table column names.
KijiTableLayout Layout of a Kiji table.
SchemaTableAvroResolver Resolves AvroSchema descriptors into Schema objects through a KijiSchemaTable.
TableLayoutBuilder An experimental table layout builder class.
TableLayoutBuilder.LayoutOptions Options to normalize table layout descriptors.
 

Enum Summary
ColumnReaderSpec.AvroDecoderType For Avro encoded columns, specifies the type of decoder to use: generic or specific.
ColumnReaderSpec.AvroReaderSchemaType For Avro encoded columns, specify which reader schema to apply when decoding cells.
ColumnReaderSpec.Encoding Master encoding of the column's content.
TableLayoutBuilder.LayoutOptions.SchemaFormat Ways to represent an Avro schema.
 

Exception Summary
InvalidLayoutException Thrown when an invalid Kiji layout is encountered.
InvalidLayoutSchemaException Thrown when a table layout or a layout update includes invalid or incompatible reader and writer schemas.
LayoutUpdatedException Exception which indicates that an operation has failed due to a concurrent KijiTableLayout update.
SchemaClassNotFoundException Thrown when a Kiji table layout has a schema class reference that cannot be loaded (probably because it is not on the class path).
 

Package org.kiji.schema.layout Description

Kiji table layouts.

A Kiji table has a layout that describes the locality groups, families, and columns it contains. This package contains code for serializing the layout metadata to and from JSON or binary Avro records, and persisting it into the Kiji system tables in HBase. Kiji table layouts are persisted in the KijiMetaTable. Kiji records the history of the layouts of each table. When updating the layout of a table, Kiji validates the new layout against the current layout of the table. Kiji table layouts are serialized to descriptors as TableLayoutDesc Avro records (see the Avro record definitions in src/main/avro/Layout.avdl). Kiji table layouts are internally represented as KijiTableLayout instances. KijiTableLayout wraps layout descriptors, validate layout updates, assigns column IDs and provides convenience accessors.
